text: José Meiffret (1913–1983, born Boulouris, France) was a cyclist who set a world motor-paced speed record of 204.73 km/h (127.243 mi/h) behind a Mercedes-Benz 300SL on the German Autobahn on July 19, 1962"Date with Death", by Clifford L. Graves, M.D., Bicycling Magazine (September 1965) at Freiburg Germany. This record was set on a bicycle setup with a 130-tooth chainring, weighing 20 kg and equipped with wooden rims.José Meiffret with photo Pneus Durex advert "José Meiffret"] * Meiffret, José. (1965). Mes Rendez-vous avec la Mort. Flammarion. == See also == Cycling records ==References== ==External links== *A synopsis of José's world record ride *A picture of the bike used for the record, now in a Parisean Museum *Motor-Paced Cycle Speed Attempt Ends – Disaster 1952 Category:1913 births Category:1988 deaths Category:French male cyclists Category:People from Saint-Raphaël, Var Category:Sportspeople from Var (department)
title: José Meiffret
